title: The Bell Ringers Podcast: Did Trump's Fake Phone Call Save The Market?
text:
Join Investing.com senior analysts Jesse Cohen and Clement Thibault as they review the most significant events that impacted financial markets last week and look ahead to what are likely to be the top business and financial stories in the week ahead.

The format is simple: the two will spend three minutes talking about each topic; a bell then sounds once time is up, whereupon they'll move on to the next topic.

You can listen to this week's episode on Spotify (NYSE: ) here: https://open.spotify.com/episode/2EZX3cJrAVZMTKQhMJmSgl

This week’s episode starts with: thoughts on yet another wild and crazy week on , where U.S. stocks ended a on a high note thanks to a phone call that President Donald Trump said took place between U.S. and Chinese trade negotiators - something which Beijing has left largely unconfirmed (01:30-04:45).

Next up: The two discussed last week’s relatively strong , which revealed the strongest pace of consumer spending in more than four years, and whether fears of an impending recession are justified (04:45-08:30).

Finally, the two talk about the latest as markets grapple with the fallout from U.K. Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s suspension of parliament (08:30-12:30).

Turning their attention to the week ahead, the duo provided their opinions and thoughts on how markets are likely to perform in the coming days and whether we’re setting up for another volatile week as September kicks off (12:30-17:00).

The two also touched on what’s in store on the data front, with the monthly report as well as fresh readings on and indices all on the agenda in the days ahead (17:00-21:40).

Finally, the two also focused on the latest batch of quarterly earnings due this week, including financial results from recent IPOs Slack Technologies (NYSE: ) and Zoom Video Communications (NASDAQ: ) (21:40-26:40).

To close out the episode, they each provided their stock of the week: Palo Alto Networks (NYSE: ) for Jesse (26:40-28:20) and Philip Morris (NYSE: ) for Clement (28:20-30:00).

Find us on Twitter for feedback @Investingcom, @BellRingersPod, @JesseCohenInv, and @ClemThibault!

Disclaimer: At the time of writing, neither Jesse nor Clement own shares in any of the companies mentioned. The views discussed in the podcast are solely the opinion of the hosts and should not be taken as investment advice.
